thread.title: Vodafone's new postpaid plans offer bundled data and unlimited calling, start at Rs 499
thread.title_full: Vodafone's new postpaid plans offer bundled data and unlimited calling, start at Rs 499

title: Vodafone's new postpaid plans offer bundled data and unlimited calling, start at Rs 499
text:
January 23, 2017 “Vodafone’s new RED plans offer up to 54GB of data, unlimited calling and more” 
Vodafone has crossed the 200 million subscribers base in India, and the brand is celebrating it with new plans. The telco has launched new Vodafone RED plans for its postpaid users with unlimited local and STD calling, data benefits, free incoming on national roaming, 100 free SMSes and premium subscription of Vodafone Play service. The plans start at Rs 499, and go as high as Rs 1,999 depending on the benefits. 
The Rs 499 Vodafone Red plan offers 1GB of non-4G data, 3GB of 4G data and additional 5GB data on the telco’s Wi-Fi hotspots. The Rs 699 plan offers 2.5GB of non-4G data, 5GB of 4G data, and additional 5GB of Wi-Fi hotspot data. The RED Rs 999 plan offers 5GB of non-4G data, 8GB of 4G data and 10GB of Wi-Fi data. The RED Rs 1,299 plan offers 8GB of non-4G data, 12GB of 4G data and 10GB of Wi-Fi data. 
The Rs 1,699 plan comes with 16GB of non-4G data, 20GB of 4G data and 10GB of Wi-Fi data. Lastly, the Rs 1,999 Vodafone Red plan features 20GB of non-4G data, 24GB of 4G data and 10GB of Wi-Fi data. The Rs 1,299, Rs 1,699 and Rs 1,999 plans also offer unlimited local and STD outgoing on national roaming as well. 
Prices of Vodafone’s new unlimited RED plans will vary from region to region. They are currently not available in MPCG, AP&T, Bihar and Jharkhand, Jammu & Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh. Facebook Comments
